chatroom example

1) Description

Chatroom is a command line chat application that allows users to exchange messages.

2) Scenario

A java client sends a message to DDS component (via a Camel Processor) which will publish it to other users through the defined Camel route (from (dds...)). When a message comes from DDS, it will be displayed by a process defined in the route "from (dds ...)".

  • In the figure below we see the two routes used in Camel server
  • The sample contains 3 fields :
    • string     userID;     (string type) // owner of message
    • long       index;      (long type) // message number
    • string     content;     (string type) // message body

3) Design

It consists of 1 unit :

  • DDSChatDemo : a class that creates a chat user (chatter),sends a message to a DDS component ( which publishes it to other users ) and receives messges from other users through a Camel route (from DDS)

4) Building/Running

Environment Setup

  • Make sure to have Maven executable (mvn) and Java executable in PATH.
  • Make sure to have Vortex OpenSplice environment set (on Linux sourcing Vortex OpenSplice's release.com file).

Building the example:

  • Change directory to examples/chatroom and execute:
    • mvn package

Running the Java example:

  • Start the Vortex OpenSplice services:
    • ospl start
  • Open a command prompt and change directory to examples/chatroom. Enter the following command:
    • mvn exec:java -Dexec.args="user1"
  • Open another command prompt in examples/chatroom directory and enter the following command:
    • mvn exec:java -Dexec.args="user2"
  • Type a message on one of the terminals and hit ENTER. The message will appear on the other terminal.

Exiting the demo

  • Type 'quit' and hit ENTER.
